1.content:
This is where it all begins. It starts with the main protagonist waking up and finding out that they are a disembodied head. What will they do about it? With these choices, build your own character with their own profile and then send them off on their disembodied case. Let's hope they don't lose their heads.

If possible, try to keep the protagonist diverse. Like I do not want a bunch of teenage girls or boys. Include some adults or kids if possible. If they are teens, just don't make this story be overflowed by them.

Have fun!
1.title: Introductions

11.content:
Name: Yui (I'll think of a last name later)

Age: Around her teens

Race: Japanese

Personality: A detective like girl who is friendly and normal until she lost her head on that faithful day. She is determined to get things done either it be when people need help or getting her head back onto her body.

Facts: Her parents have jobs that involves searching clues like her father being a real detective while her mother is a psychiatric that knows how you feel.

So what form of headlessness will Yui go through?

"I guess with psychic powers." said Yui's body.

"This is too odd. Put me back!" cried Yui's head.

"Sure!" said the body as she puts her head on her neck. However the head fell off.

"NO!" cried Yui's head before her body caught her.

"Safe." said the body.

"Have any idea how can this happen to us?" asked the head.

"No. It just happened out of nowhere." said the body.

"Oh my, it's like my body has her own personality." said the head.

"It's as if my head has her own personality." said Yui's body.

"Am I really Yui or are you Yui?" asked the head.

"I guess we are one in the same." said the body.

"We have to find out why this happens to us." said the head.

"How can we if we look like this?" asked the body.

"Hmm." thought the head.

1111.content:

"Yui, what's wrong?" asked the body.

"I just miss being able to wear clothes or being attached. I am not sure if I am Yui or if you are Yui. Am I just a copy of her memories or you?" said the head.

"The best thing we can come up with is that we are both Yui. To make is simple, I'll call you head and you call me body. Anyone else can call you Yui's head and call me Yui's body. Together we are Yui." said the body telepathically.

"That sounds kind of cute." said the head, "Now, how can we get past 'our' parents?"

"Scarf." said the body.

The body has a scarf and wraps it around her neck. She then places her head on it's neck as Yui's head felt wobbly. Though it stood still.

"It feels so soft." said Yui's head she begin walking only for her head to fall off. She rolled all the way to the door with a thud.

"Ow." said the head.

"Sorry. You know what they say about crazy things like this. Heads will roll." said the body.

"Ha ha, very funny. Will some 'body' give me other ideas how we can hide this?" said the head.

"Hmm, duct tape." suggested the body.

"Let's try it." said the head.

The body got the duct tape and puts some on it's neck. The body puts her head on and it sort of work, but Yui's head was slipping. The body puts her hood on to keep the head from falling.

"This might work." said the head.

"Now, let's go downstairs, and go find out how we got separated." said the body.

Yui walked down stairs and spotted her mother making breakfast while her father is drinking coffee. As she tries to skip breakfast, she heard her mother say.

"Stop right there young lady. I know something is wrong in the morning." said the mother.

"You got me." said Yui.

"So, what happened?" asked the mother.

"Uh, would you believe me if I tell you that I can take my head off?" asked Yui.

"I would!" said the father, "Then I can finally have a supernatural case."

Both of Yui's parents have jobs that deals with being a detective. Yui's father is a real detective while her mother works as a psychologist. They both can tell what Yui is up too.

Yui proceeds to take her head off as both of her parents are shocked.

"Don't worry honey! I will investigate on who decapitated you and find out how you lived!" declared the father as he dropped his coffee and ran out to investigate.

"Impossible!" shouted the mother, "Maybe I'm stressing out or..."

Yui's mother fainted as Yui has no idea what to do now.

"What can we do?" asked Yui's head.

"Well I can't talk to them, but I can help mom out a bit. You sit at the table and eat some toast while I get mom to the couch."

Yui's body places her head on the kitchen table and stuff a piece of toast into her mouth.

The head muffle, "How can I eat without a stomach?"

"What if I told you than an Irish lady's voice told me that you can? It happened in a dream." said the body.

"I think I heard it too, but I forgot." said the head.

The body left while the head continues to nibble on the toast. The tv in the kitchen was still on as the head saw something odd. Commercials were playing and they all seemed to have one thing in common. There was an Irish purple haired lady for some reason.

One commercial features her as a volunteer for a magic act where her head is cut off. Another is a tech company add that involves jar heads. The strangest thing of all is that her voice is similar to the one in her dream.

Yui's head dropped the toast in her mouth as she found a clue to her state. Could this woman be responsible for everything that just happened?

12.content:
In front of a secluded beach in Southern California a battered RV bakes peacefully in the sun, its three occupants snoring loudly and contently in their personal slice of heaven. Unfortunately for them, their morning was about to get much louder and much less peaceful. It all started with the sound of an ancient electronic alarm going off, its shrill shrieks stirring the vehicle/apartment's occupants.

The first to speak was the one seated with a tattered blanket thrown over him in the driver's seat. Known as Jones he was a relatively tall and lean man in his mid early to mid thirties, though no one knew his exact age. Or his last name. Or if Jones was even his real name. Or why he never shaved the scraggly and uneven patches of black he called a beard. Unwilling to leave his chair just yet, Jones called back "Kristi! Alarm!" The alarm continued to beep. "Kristi! It's your turn to get the alarm!"

Refusing to move from the sleeping bag she resided in Kristi Fields grumbled "Nuh uh, I got it yesterday! It's totally your turn, man!"

"BS, you say that every freaking morning! I got it yesterday, you haven't turned off the alarm in like a year!" Jones countered angrily, not sure if he actually had turned off the alarm yesterday or not but definitely sure that Kristi didn't do it.

"SHUT UP!" A third voice demanded, the short and well curved olive skinned body belonging to said voice rising ominously from the RV's only actual bed like Count Dracula. A half hateful and half asleep glare scanned the room for the source of the damnable beeping. Sighting the alarm amidst a heap of greasy but clean picked Chinese takeout boxes, the dour young woman tossed her blanket aside and stumbled stumbled to her feet, revealing that she'd gone to sleep in her stained, crumpled, and slightly musty Dan's Diner uniform. The name tag she'd not bothered to remove before collapsing into her bed read "Collie Summer at your service!" This was in spite of the fact that her name was actually Collie Sumter, though she doubted her boss noticed the mistake or cared enough to fix it.

Stumbling over to the alarm,nearly tripping over a half dozen curios Jones had scrounged up with his metal detector, magazines Collie had read enough times to memorize, and wrappers for microwave meals that Kristi had been too lazy and to whiny to take down the street to the nearest public trash can, Collie commented "Jeez, you two are such big babies. It's a wonder either of you can hold down a steady job. OH WAIT! YOU CAN'T!"

Jones scoffed at the remark, and waved a dismissive hand as he said "Forgive me, your majesty, for not wanting to involve myself in the soul crushing system of the man that is capitalism."

"I swear to God if you charged a penny of rent I'd leave you two freeloader hippies to starve so fast..." Collie muttered. While she technically paid for just about everything the three of them used, including food, water, gas, power, clothes, RV repairs, and about half of their surfing equipment, the RV was Jones', as was the amazing private parking spot right on the beach that he legally owned due to a loophole in California state zoning law (which he inexplicably knew), and he allowed she and Kristi to live there rent free for as long as they chose to, which was coming up on three years for Kristi and was just over four for Collie herself.

Collie turned the alarm off, and was about to make a jab about Jones' general hippie attitude and constant crazed ramblings about the sinister machinations of 'the man', when she noticed something odd out of her peripheral vision. Turning to get a better view she stared at her housemate Kristi's sleeping bag, noting that while her head was poking out the end of it the bag itself seemed... flat. As though there was nothing in it. Walking over to it Collie took hold of the fabric and lifted the sleeping bag off the ground, her eyes widening in shock at the sight before her.

"AH!" She screamed, dropping the empty bag to the grimy floor.

"Jesus, what?!" Kristi asked, looking in annoyed confusion at her horrified friend.

"Y-your body!" Collie said, pointing below Kristi's neck.

"What about my..." Kristi stopped, realizing that she couldn't look down. Her neck twitched but her head simply refused to look down. Concentrating, Kristi realized that not only could she not move, but she couldn't even see her body below her relatively small nose. "What the hell is going on? I can't move!"

Hearing the commotion Jones slides out of his chair and turned to the living area. Upon seeing what Collie saw he stumbled back and said simply "Woah!"

"Would someone explain to me what's wrong?!" Kristi demanded, her friends' horrified expressions rubbing off on her.

Jones and Collie looked at one another, exchanging a wordless expression that ended with both of them nodding. Collie turned back and placed her hands around Kristi's head and lifted her up. Kristi made unintelligible noises as her friend effortlessly moved her, as though she weighed only a couple pounds. Collie then turned her around and carried her into the bathroom area of the RV, showing her the mirror.

"MY BODY!" Kristi screamed, tears welling up in her eyes. Kristi used to have the athletic body of a twenty five year old professional surfer (what with her BEING a twenty five year old professional surfer, along with both her twenty four and 32-36ish year old housemates), well muscled and darkly tanned with a nice plump butt and small yet perky breasts. Now, however, she had nothing, she was merely a thin faced and dirty blond head being carried by her friend Collie. "What the hell happened to me? Where the hell is my freaking body? How am I supposed to compete in the Riptide Royale now?!"

"I don't- Wait." Collie stopped, turning her friends' head to face her. "Seriously? You're worried about that surfing competition now? You're a talking severed freaking head and your first concern is a stupid contest?"

"WE'VE BEEN PRACTICING FOR MONTHS!" Kristi whined "THE PRIZE WAS $25,000! THE CONTEST IS IN A WEEK AND HOW THE HELL AM I SUPPOSED TO COMPETE WHEN I DON'T EVEN HAVE A BODY!"

Collie shook her head "I can't even... Look, just calm down alright? Let's just think about this. You're still alive despite being severed from your body and missing your... basically every vital organ. That means we can assume your body is alive even without your head. All we have to do is find it."

Kristi tried to calm herself, breathing more slowly. "Yeah, yeah you're right. We just need to find my body. After that we can... do something. Find a way to reattach me. Whatever, first things first we have to find me."

Jones entered the restroom with the two girls "Can you feel your body? Maybe if you can feel it we can get a better idea of where
it is."

Kristi closed here eyes, concentrating. "I... I can feel...

124.content:
"It's like a sort of... pressure? Or energy? I can't really describe it well but I can definitely feel something below my neck that isn't my body." Kristi said, her eyes clenched tightly in concentration.

"Woah!" Collie and Jones said in near perfect unison, breaking Kristi's concentration.

Suddenly Kristi felt like she was falling, air whipping past her ears as her head plummeted to the plastic floor. Just before she hit the ground Collie caught her, lifting her back up to eye level. "What the hell, why'd you drop me?! I could've been seriously hurt by that!" Kristi complained, trying to catch her breath despite not having any lungs at the moment.

"I didn't drop you, you levitated right out of my hands!" Collie said, to which Jones nodded in agreement. "When you opened your eyes you stopped floating."

"No way... really?" Kristi said. She then concentrated again, this time with her eye open. After a few moments and a build up of pressure she suddenly stopped feeling Collie's hands on her face and saw that her field of view was indeed rising. Thinking some more she turned herself back towards the mirror and saw that indeed her head was suspended in the air before her. Now it was her turn to say "Woah." She then giggled as she spun herself back around to face her friends.

"What the hell kind of CIA level crap is this?" Jones wondered aloud, limbo-ing right under Kristi's floating noggin just to convince himself that this was indeed happening and he wasn't hallucinating.

"Don't tell me you honestly think they're the ones behind this." Collie said with crossed arms, not sure if her friend was joking or not.

"Well I'm sorry do you know anyone else with the kind of technology necessary to make... this!" He said, pointing to Kristi's living and levitating severed head. "Other than, like, DARPA or The Fed or..."

"Why the hell would the government be interested in decapitating some random chick that lives in a van and imbuing her with quasi magic powers?!" Collie demanded. "Look, let's just concentrate on the small picture for now alright? We'll get down to what secret service branch decided to sneak into a trailer and science up a separation ray or whatever later, for now let's just focus on what we're going to do to find her body."

"I have an idea." Kristi said. "Depending on how high I can float I could probably get a better view on the streets than any of us could on foot or in the RV, so why don't I act as our eye in the sky while you two search on foot?"

Collie scratched her head. "I dunno if that's a good idea, I mean you fell earlier when you stopped lost your concentration. What if you run into a bird or a kite or something, I mean falling five feet in the RV is one thing but from a couple stories up..."

"I'm learning quickly!" Kristi said, doing a little loop-the-loop to prove her point. "Besides people are less likely to notice me while I'm way up in the air. On the ground I'll either have to be hidden in one of your backpacks or attract a TON of attention by floating around with you guys."

"We're going to attract attention anyway, I mean eventually we're gonna have to ask SOMEONE if they've seen the headless body of a surfer chick stumbling around." Jones says. "Assuming your body hasn't been taken back to CIA headquarters for testing or whatever." Before Collie could tell him that he wasn't helping with that last comment Jones said "Wait, hang on." Jones left the restroom and began rummaging around in one of the RV's closets, emptying out half the contents onto the already cluttered floor before finding... some string and a Halloween face painting set. "Kristi, you may have been on to something earlier. "Look, until we learn more about how any of this works it's just not safe to have you hovering above the city without us. What if you run out of energy or magic or whatever? Or what if you find your body but can't get back on it? You couldn't contact us if you did, you'd just be stuck." Collie said, shooting down Jones' flying idea. "We'll just have to carry you around with us for now. Don't worry, we'll get your body back in no time!"

"Fine, whatever, just hurry up and let's get going!" Kristi said, slightly disappointed that she wouldn't get to do more flying.

"A please would be nice." Jones joked, trying to lighten the mood. Kristi simply glared at him in response. Pulling a battered old hiking backpack out of the closet and dumping out its contents (among which were expired granola bars, tangled fishing line, a compass that didn't point north, and a first aid kit that had never been opened) Jones motioned for Kristi to hide inside. Kristi floated herself in and maneuvered so that she was facing up, checking that none of her short dirty blond hair would be caught in the zipper when it was closed. "Alright, just sit tight. If you need to tell us something just whistle, we'll slip off the street and talk in private."

"Sure." Kristi said, trying to force an optimistic smiled onto her face in spite of everything. Without another word Jones zipped up the backpack and Kristi was plunged into almost total darkness, the thick rain resistant padding of the camping bag stopping nearly all light from passing through. Kristi felt herself being lifted up then shaken as the backpack is thrown over Jones' shoulders.

"So, where should we look first?" Collie asked, her voice muffled and distant through the bag.

"Uh...we should start at the beach and work our way into the city from there. If we overhear anyone talking about a headless surfer chick stumbling around we'll ask where they saw it but otherwise we should keep our mouths shut about our friend's 'condition'. Wouldn't want to start a panic. Or draw too much attention to ourselves, even if it ain't the Fed behind this then they'd probably pull us in for questioning and throw Kristi in a lab forever." With that she and Jones stepped out of the RV and began combing the beach. Being early in the morning on a weekday there weren't a whole lot of people around, and eavesdropping in on a few of their conversations none seemed to be talking about a headless body running around. 154.content:
Tyler Ord is a rather typical 40 year old man. He works 8:30 to 5:00 at a boring but well paying office job, he has two beautiful children he loves dearly, he is a little out of shape but does enough jogging to keep himself chubby rather than fat, and right up until this morning he thought he had a pretty stable life.

That notion was proven false at exactly 7:00am one Wednesday morning, when the buzzing of Tyler's alarm clock roused him from a very deep sleep and a very strange dream. He dreamed that after a particularly lovely dinner of capers and milk, his kids had hugged so hard that his head had popped off and floated away from his body like a balloon, into a sea of clouds made of diamonds. Normally Tyler's dreams were just random colors and the occasional face, so dreaming of something so tangible in and of itself was an oddity, an oddity which compounded with the strange subject matter of the dream. Tyler was about to roll over and tell his partner about the strangeness of his dream, when he realized that he couldn't. Tyler couldn't move any part of his body. In fact, he couldn't feel any part of his body. Everything below his neck was completely numb.

His eyes snapping open, Tyler quickly noticed something unnerving about his position. His head was at an impossible angle, his chin resting flat against his pillow, as though his neck and body were embedded inside the bed. "What the fuuu!" Tyler yelped as his world suddenly lurched and spun in a blur of colors. He hit his carpeted floor hard, his face and messy bedhead grinding across the floor as he rolled across the room. He came to a stop when his scalp bumped into his dresser, facing the bedroom's standing mirror.

"OH MY GOD!" Tyler squealed, his horrified face reflected perfectly in the mirror. He was just a severed head, his body nowhere to be seen! "OH MY GOD OH MY GOD OH MY GOD!" He repeated, unable to accept what he saw. How was this happening? How was he alive? How was he talking without a body? Where was his body?

Tyler heard his door open, his panicked screams attracting one of his family members. It was...
154.title: Tyler Ord

Leslie Barker was a 40 year old banker with two kids, a small but comfortable house in the suburbs, and absolutely nothing going on in her life. She drank wine and watched cheesy movies every night, she rode a bike to and from work to keep her wine and couch potato habits in check, and on the weekends she read books and played family board games. In all respects, she was mundane but content with her lot in life.

Then, one lazy Sunday morning, she awoke to see a living, headless body poking her on the nose. A living headless body wearing her raggedy old blue pajamas with the collar cut way too low. A living headless body that had the same Florida shaped birthmark on her sternum and a figure that was identical to her own. A living headless body that, judging by the fact that she couldn't move at all and that her chin was resting flat against her dresser, was hers. She'd somehow been decapitated, survived with blank patches of smooth skin on her neck rather than gory stumps or taxidermy stitches, and now her body seemed to have a mind of its own and was just as confused about her current predicament as she was.

info.brief_description: You wake up one morning to find yourself bodiless. What will you do?
info.description:
It's finally here! The premise is that you make your own character who loses their head and have them try to figure out why this happened to them. The character can be any age, race, gender, and so on.

Rules(Sorry, but it's to ensure that this story will be tasteful):

No sex with minors. If there is any, don't go into too much details on it.

Head has to stay detached until he or she solves the mystery of how they lost their head unless they can find a substitute body that does not involve head swaps. Unless the person can take their head off and is in a similar position as the protagonist.

The body can talk to the head telepathically, but only to the head. No one else can hear him or her.

Head and body need to be together to stay alive as the body provide movement and the head is used for communication, senses, and eating.

No prior boyfriends or girlfriends. I'm just sick of this with protagonist that already have one. Trying to have a new change of pace.

The character has to earn the love relationship and it needs to be develop. Have a few chapters(About 7-10) of them building it until it's official.

Desent grammar would be nice and make the chapters descent at least. Not too short like one sentence or a word.
